pull.title: Avoid recalculating vchKeyedNetGroup in eviction logic.
pull.body:
Lazy calculate vchKeyedNetGroup in CNode::GetKeyedNetGroup.

This is a (very small) performance improvement.

Fix mentioned by gmaxwell in #8086

rename.from: Avoid recalculating vchKeyedNetGroup in eviction logic.

events.body: bleh. There really is no reason to do this lazily. It should eagerly generate it at connection time, saving a hashing operation that it's going to perform anyways is not a good trade-off for having an extra heap allocation.  Doubly so when the hash is changed to siphash.

events.message:
Avoid recalculating vchKeyedNetGroup in eviction logic.

Lazy calculate vchKeyedNetGroup in CNode::GetKeyedNetGroup.

rename.to: Avoid recalculating vchKeyedNetGroup in eviction logic.

events.body: Concept ACK. I think SHA256 is still overkill, but this is a clear improvement.
This should be closed, was merged via 8086->8173.

comments.body: Use a uint256, or even a uint64_t.

uint64_t please.   The probability that two distinct net-groups share a 64-bit hash is negligible, and if it ever happens its harmless (and would have no effect at all unless it's a collision with one of the four lowest ones that are in use).
